div.p: Now let me show you how to quickly

set up a site and keep
everything you need -

notes, mailboxes, documents,
schedules, and newsfeeds -

all shared in one place,
helping to organize
and keep your team in sync.
The first step is to create a new site
by clicking here , and giving it a name.
Then click Create, and, just like that,
your site is up and running.

Now let's take a look at
the Getting Started tiles.
With these, you can change the look

and feel of your site and add
all kinds of functionality.
By clicking on What Is Your Style,

you can choose a theme
from a list of templates.
I like this one, so I select it
and then drag and drop an image
for the site background.
From the Your Site Your Brand tile,

you can also add a logo
and update the title
and description of the site, as required.

Now let's make it a true
collaborative space for a team.
You can add and assign tasks

and use a calendar to
organize upcoming meetings.
We'll show you more about tasks
and calendars in another video,
where we'll drill down a bit deeper.
By clicking the Share Your Site tile,
you can invite team members to join.
With Office 365, you can also invite
people from outside your organization,

as long as your IT admin has
activated external sharing.
Don't forget to follow the site
to add it to your favorite lists!
You can also click Sync to synchronize
your files locally so that you always
have access to them, even when offline.
By clicking the Keep Email In Context tile,
you can even set up a site mailbox
that everyone on the team can access.

And by default, each site
comes with a newsfeed
to keep everyone on the same page,

as well as a document
library to make it easy

easy to store and organize
your content in one place.
As you can see, it only takes a few clicks
to set up a site.
Then you can easily customize your site
to fit your needs even better.
Just browse through the available apps
and add more,
like a Picture Library.

You can even add custom
apps from your organization
or apps from the Office Store.
Once you're finished, you can hide
the Getting Started tiles from your site.
At any time, you can reactivate them

by clicking here and going
to Getting Started.
